info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 8:12PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Hamilton and northeastern Fulton Counties through 845 PM EDT... At 812 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Caroga Lake, or 9 miles north of Gloversville, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, penny size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rains could cause ponding of water on roads and in urban or poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Edinburg, Northville, Northampton Beach Public Campground, Cranberry Creek, Bleecker, Hope, Benson, Fairchilds Corners, Hope Falls, Bleecker Center, Sweets Crossing, Pinnacle, Bowlers Corners, Peters Corners, Lindsley Corners, Maple Grove, Carpenters Corners, Dennies Hollow, Clarkville and Tomantown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
